content: Does drinking milk or consuming dairy products increase mucus production in people with cold or flu congestion?

No, there is no scientific evidence to support the idea that drinking milk or consuming dairy products increases mucus production in people with cold or flu congestion. This is a common myth, but research has shown that dairy products do not cause the body to produce more mucus.

In fact, dairy products can be a good source of nutrients and may help soothe a sore throat or provide comfort during illness. It's important to continue eating a balanced diet, including dairy if tolerated, to support overall health and immune function.

If you experience discomfort or feel that dairy worsens your symptoms, it's always a good idea to consult with a healthcare professional for personalized advice.
